image.alt_text: Photo by Kris Mac on September 21, 2020.
image.caption:
For those who don't know what's happening in southwest Nova Scotia: Mi'kmaw lobster fishers are being harassed and having their traps cut by commercial fisherman while DFO and RCMP stand by. The rights of the indigenous fishers are affirmed both by the 1752 treaty and by the Supreme Court in 1999. This picture was taken at the Saulnierville wharf, Digby Co.

#mikmaqterritory #mikmaki #alleyesonmikmaki #mikmaqfishing #mikmaqstrong #migmaq #grandcouncilflag #1752 #1752treaty #treatyrights #treatyrightsmatter #donaldmarshall #uncededterritory #uncededterritory #sipeknekatik #sipeknekatikstrong #saulnierville #saulniervillewharf #digbycounty #stmarysbay #fishingvillage #lobsterfishing #lobsterharvest #indigenousharvest #indigenousrights #indigenousresistance #fuckracism #solidarity

image.alt_text: Photo by Steve Bell | Treaty 1 on October 17, 2020.
image.caption:
I can't imagine the terror of being surrounded in the night by hundreds of villagers threatening to burn you out because you were exercising your constitutionally "protected" sovereign right to a modest living off the resources of your unceded traditional territory. And then, being wrenched out of your building by "law enforcement" only to watch the police stand by while others destroy your property. 

https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/mi-kmaw-lobster-fishery-unrest-1.5761468

I don't understand. The police physically remove and arrest peaceful pipeline protesters in BC, but stand by and watch violent mobs in the Maritimes? 

Did this just happen? 

And there is something that doesn't add up about this claim that the Mi'kmaw fishers are threatening stocks: 

"Sipekne’katik First Nation has seven licenses and only three are being used at the moment. Each license has 50 traps for a total of 150 traps. The commercial fishery in that zone, which is much bigger than just St. Mary’s Bay, allows for up to 390,000 traps." 

https://www.aptnnews.ca/national-news/the-facts-behind-mikmaw-fishing-rights/

In other words, the Mi'kmaw fishers hold and use a fraction of one per cent of licenced traps. Unless I'm missing something significant, this doesn't appear to be about conservation or significant threat to other's livelihood.

#Mikmaq #AllEyesOnMikmaki #TreatyRights #cdnpoli #settlerviolence

image.alt_text: Photo by Darren Calabrese on October 27, 2020.
image.caption:
Some work from southwest Nova Scotia where Mi’kmaq lobster fishers from the Sipekne’katik First Nation  launched its constitutionally affirmed moderate livelihood fishery.
Even though it’s been 21 years since the Supreme Court ruled that Canada must recognize Indigenous fishing rights, Mi’kmaq fishers have faced violence and intimidation from non-Indigenous commercial fishers as they continue to fight prejudice over their right to earn a moderate living on the water.
And, don’t forget, this is all playing out through October, which is Mi’kmaq History Month.
•••••
Reporting for @globeandmail with @greg_mercer.

image.alt_text: Photo shared by NM Climate Justice on February 16, 2021 tagging @puebloactionalliance, @tewawomenunited, @yucca.nm, @stopthemoneypipeline, @therednation.southwest, and @votesfortheplanet. May be an illustration of text.
image.caption:
@stopthemoneypipeline TONIGHT! 6pm MST  Link in our bio: The #DefundLine3 Launch Party goes live  as we kick off an urgent 8 week action campaign to choke off the flow of capital to @Enbridge and the #Line3 tar sands pipeline stomping on #TreatyRights.

5pm PST  6pm MST| 7pm CST  8pm EST
Reserve your spot with the link in our bio to be part of the event on zoom → or watch on our Facebook page!

In solidarity with Water Protectors on the front lines in Anishinaabe lands in Minnesota, we are racing against Enbridge’s next big credit renewal deadline, March 31, when a credit facility renewal worth $2.16 billion will expire. The banks involved in that loan have to make a decision whether to continue to support Line 3 or walk away from Enbridge.

Those banks include @Chase, @Citi, @BankofAmerica, @RBC & @TDbank_US. If you bank with them - you should move your money. And either way, you should join our push to force them to face up to their #ClimateResponsibilities. 

#StopTheMoneyPipeline #MoveYourMoney #ClimateFinance #IndigenousRights 

Art by @JackieFawn

image.alt_text: Photo shared by Tim Evans on August 26, 2021 tagging @honortheearth, @resist_line_3, @migizi_will_fly, and @redlaketreatycamp. May be an image of one or more people, people standing, outdoors and monument.
image.caption:
Yesterday, thousands of indigenous Americans and their supporters gathered at the Minnesota State Capitol in St. Paul to protest the Enbridge Line 3 pipeline. With the pipeline nearing completion, demonstrators called on @mngovernor and @potus to pull permits on the project, which will transport more than 800,000 barrels of crude tar sands oil a day across hundreds of pristine northern MN rivers and wetlands, risking oil spills and violating Anishinaabe treaty rights in the process. Throughout this week, a smaller contingent of people have been camping out on the Capitol lawn to put pressure on politicians.

For @bloomberg 

#stopline3 #waterprotectors #climatecrisis #minnesota #waterislife #blacksnake #protest #stpaulmn #treatyrights #indigenous #indigenousrights #mmiw #greennewdeal
